intro: Picrasma denhamii, commonly known as the Denham's picrasma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Picrasmales and is characterized by its woody structure and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded forest environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
